page.title: 19 CUDHAM - GARAGE
page.content: Taking the place of the old village blacksmith in the vital area of transport is the modern garage. Cudham garage is a family business situated in the centre of the village and occupies a building thought to be 80-100 years old and at one time housing the village wheelwright. The garage employs four full-time and two part-time men to do car services, repairs, Ministry of Transport Tests and attend breakdowns and accidents. Clients come from a area of 8-9 miles in radius. The garage is open Mon-Sat and performs as many as 70-80 M.O.T.s a week with August being the busiest month. An M.O.T. test takes 20-30 minutes to complete and takes place in a special bay, which may have to be enlarged in the future. The garage sells an average of 200 gallons of petrol a day.
